title: the Obsidian Reach
intro: Iyla is a high-priest of Chandrasar, the Bastion of the Lunaries, a race of four-armed mortals who dwell in the moon's shadow. Tall, graceful, and eerily pale, she wields four Chakrams with hypnotic precision. On the battlefield, she is a whirlwind of silver steel, keeping enemies at bay with a constant flow of blades that return to her many hands like loyal servants.

abilities.name: Quad-Wielding Rhythm
abilities.details: Every 4th basic attack of Iyla deals bonus [ap]magical damage[/] (scaling with [ad]physical power[/] and [ap]magical power[/]).

abilities.name: Crescent Convergence
abilities.details:
Iyla throws two chakrams that travel in opposing outward arcs before meeting at a target location. The blades deal [ad]physical damage[/] (scaling with [ad]physical power[/]) to all enemies they pass through.

Upon reaching the meeting point, the blades snap together, dealing bonus [ad]physical damage[/] (scaling with [ad]physical power[/]) and [db]slowing[/] enemies in a small area before returning to Iyla.

The returning blades deal reduced damage.

abilities.name: Lunar Guard
abilities.details:
Iyla plants her feet and holds her chakrams in a defensive stance for a short duration. While in this stance, she blocks all [bf]basic attacks[/] and takes [bf]reduced damage[/] from the enemies.

The damage reduction does not apply for damage-over-time.

abilities.name: Moonphase Shift
abilities.details: Iyla blinks to a target location. If there is a nearby enemy hero, Iyla will perform a whirlwind slash, dealing [ad]physical damage[/] (scaling with [ad]physical power[/]) to all nearby enemies.

abilities.name: Perfect Alignment
abilities.details:
Iyla enters a state of perfect alignment for a few seconds, gaining a massive burst of [as]attack speed[/].

During this time, her attack speed cap is [bf]removed[/], and every basic attack now launches all [bf]four[/] chakrams in rapid succession.

Each chakram deals [ad]physical damage[/] (scaling with [ad]physical power[/]) and applies on-hit effect separately.
